hero.title: NextPlate
hero.subtitle: An advanced boilerplate for full-stack developers
hero.description: Accelerate modern web application development with pre-configured authentication, payments, AI, and legal compliance.

features.title: Key Features
features.description: NextPlate includes everything you need to build modern web applications quickly.

items.title: Secure Authentication
items.description: Complete integration with Supabase and Mailgun for a robust and professional authentication experience.

items.title: Modern Interface
items.description: Elegant and accessible UI components with Shadcn, ready to customize according to your needs.

items.title: Integrated Payments
items.description: Payment and subscription processing with Stripe, including pre-configured webhooks.

items.title: Artificial Intelligence
items.description: Practical examples of OpenAI integration to add AI capabilities to your application.

items.title: Legal Compliance
items.description: Customizable legal documents and cookie banner to comply with GDPR and other regulations.

items.title: Multilingual
items.description: Support for multiple languages with pre-configured translations for Spanish and English.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.description: NextPlate is designed to be intuitive and easy to customize, following these simple steps:

steps.title: Clone the repository
steps.description: Start with a git clone to get all the base code on your local machine.

steps.title: Configure environment variables
steps.description: Customize the variables in the .env file to connect with your services (Supabase, Stripe, etc.).

steps.title: Customize components
steps.description: Modify UI components according to your design and functionality needs.

steps.title: Deploy your application
steps.description: Use Vercel or another provider to deploy your application to production.

items.quote: NextPlate saved me weeks of setup. I was able to launch my SaaS in record time.
items.author: Maria Gonzalez

items.quote: The integration with Supabase and Stripe worked perfectly from the start.
items.author: Carlos Rodriguez

items.quote: The UI components are beautiful and the documentation is clear and complete.
items.author: Ana Martinez

cta.title: Start building today
cta.description: NextPlate provides everything you need to launch your next web application quickly.

forgotPassword.title: Reset password
forgotPassword.description: Enter your email and we'll send you a link to reset your password.

auth.envVarWarning: Please update .env.local file with anon key and url

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.introduction: Welcome to NextPlate. These Terms and Conditions govern your use of our boilerplate and associated services. By using NextPlate, you agree to comply with these terms. Please read them carefully.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introduction: At NextPlate, we respect your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our boilerplate.

cookies.title: Cookie Policy
cookies.introduction: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them, and how you can control them when you use NextPlate. By using our boilerplate, you agree to the use of cookies in accordance with this policy.

meta.title: NextPlate Documentation
meta.description: Official documentation for NextPlate, a boilerplate for modern web applications.

home.title: NextPlate Documentation
home.description: Welcome to the official NextPlate documentation. Here you'll find detailed guides, tutorials, and references to help you build your application.

whatIs.title: What is NextPlate?
whatIs.description: NextPlate is a comprehensive boilerplate for Next.js applications that provides a solid foundation for building modern web applications. It includes pre-configured authentication, payments, AI integration, and legal compliance features to help you get started quickly.

getStarted.title: Getting Started
getStarted.description: Follow these steps to get started with NextPlate. You'll need Node.js 18+ and npm installed on your machine.

documentation.title: Documentation Sections
documentation.description: Explore our comprehensive documentation to learn more about NextPlate and how to use it effectively.

sections.gettingStarted: Learn the basics of NextPlate and how to set up your first project.
sections.architecture: Understand the architecture and design principles behind NextPlate.
sections.bestPractices: Discover best practices for building scalable and maintainable applications.
sections.configuration: Configure NextPlate to work with external services and APIs.
sections.development: Learn about the development workflow and tools used in NextPlate.

cleanCode.title: Clean Code
cleanCode.description: Principles and practices for writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code.

patterns.title: Design Patterns
patterns.description: Design patterns used in NextPlate to solve common problems in software development.
patterns.introduction: Design patterns are proven solutions to common problems in software development. In NextPlate, we use various design patterns to create a robust, maintainable, and scalable architecture.

creational.title: Creational Patterns
creational.description: Creational patterns focus on object creation mechanisms, trying to create objects in a manner suitable to the situation.

factoryMethod.title: Factory Method
factoryMethod.description: Defines an interface for creating an object, but lets subclasses decide which class to instantiate. Allows a class to delegate instantiation to subclasses.

singleton.title: Singleton
singleton.description: Ensures that a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.

structural.title: Structural Patterns
structural.description: Structural patterns deal with how classes and objects are composed to form larger structures.

adapter.title: Adapter
adapter.description: Allows incompatible interfaces to work together by converting the interface of a class into another interface that clients expect.

composite.title: Composite
composite.description: Composes objects into tree structures to represent part-whole hierarchies. Lets clients treat individual objects and compositions of objects uniformly.

behavioral.title: Behavioral Patterns
behavioral.description: Behavioral patterns are concerned with the communication between objects and how responsibilities are distributed.

observer.title: Observer
observer.description: Defines a one-to-many dependency between objects so that when one object changes state, all its dependents are notified and updated automatically.

strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description: Defines a family of algorithms, encapsulates each one, and makes them interchangeable. Lets the algorithm vary independently from clients that use it.

architectural.title: Architectural Patterns
architectural.description: Architectural patterns define the overall structure of a software system.

mvc.title: MVC (Model-View-Controller)
mvc.description: Separates an application into three main components: the Model (data and business logic), the View (user interface), and the Controller (handles user input).
mvc.example: In Next.js, this pattern is implemented naturally:
mvc.modelDescription: Services and utilities that handle data and business logic
mvc.viewDescription: React components that render the user interface
mvc.controllerDescription: API routes and event handlers that process user input

repository.title: Repository
repository.description: Separates the logic that retrieves data and maps it to an entity model from the rest of the business logic.

solid.title: SOLID Principles
solid.description: Learn about the best practices implemented in NextPlate to ensure code quality, maintainability, and scalability.

singleResponsibility.title: Single Responsibility Principle
singleResponsibility.description: A class or module should have only one reason to change.

openClosed.title: Open/Closed Principle
openClosed.description: Software entities should be open for extension but closed for modification.

liskovSubstitution.title: Liskov Substitution Principle
liskovSubstitution.description: Objects of a superclass should be replaceable with objects of a subclass without affecting the functionality.

interfaceSegregation.title: Interface Segregation Principle
interfaceSegregation.description: Many client-specific interfaces are better than one general-purpose interface.

dependencyInversion.title: Dependency Inversion Principle
dependencyInversion.description: High-level modules should not depend on low-level modules. Both should depend on abstractions.

implementation.title: Implementation in NextPlate
implementation.description: How SOLID principles are applied in NextPlate's architecture and code organization.

supabase.title: Supabase Configuration
supabase.description: Learn how to set up and configure Supabase for authentication and database management in NextPlate.

mailgun.title: Mailgun Configuration
mailgun.description: Learn how to set up and configure Mailgun for email delivery in NextPlate.

stripe.title: Stripe Configuration
stripe.description: Learn how to set up and configure Stripe for payment processing in NextPlate.

openai.title: OpenAI Configuration
openai.description: Learn how to set up and configure OpenAI for AI-powered features in NextPlate.

workflow.title: Development Workflow
workflow.description: Learn about the development workflow and tools used in NextPlate.

testing.title: Testing
testing.description: Learn about testing strategies and tools in NextPlate.

phases.title: Project Phases
phases.description: Understanding the different phases of a NextPlate project lifecycle, from planning to deployment and maintenance.

intro.title: Project Lifecycle Overview
intro.description: Every NextPlate project typically goes through several distinct phases, each with its own set of activities, deliverables, and best practices.

planning.title: Planning Phase
planning.description: The initial phase where project requirements are gathered, analyzed, and documented.

design.title: Design Phase
design.description: Creating the architectural blueprint and UI/UX design for the application.

development.title: Development Phase
development.description: Implementing the application features according to the design and requirements.

testing.title: Testing Phase
testing.description: Verifying that the application works as expected and meets all requirements.

deployment.title: Deployment Phase
deployment.description: Releasing the application to production and making it available to users.

maintenance.title: Maintenance Phase
maintenance.description: Ongoing support, updates, and improvements after the initial release.

i18n.title: Internationalization
i18n.description: Learn how to make your NextPlate application available in multiple languages.

deployment.title: Deployment
deployment.description: Learn how to deploy your NextPlate application to various hosting providers.

overview.description: Learn about the NextPlate API structure, authentication, and usage examples.

auth.description: Learn about the authentication endpoints available in NextPlate.

users.description: Learn about the user management endpoints available in NextPlate.

payments.description: Learn about the payment processing endpoints available in NextPlate.

webhooks.title: Webhooks API
webhooks.description: Learn about the webhook endpoints available in NextPlate for integrating with external services.

overview.title: UI Components
overview.description: Learn about the reusable UI components available in NextPlate.

forms.title: Form Components
forms.description: Learn about the form components available in NextPlate for creating interactive and accessible forms.

data.title: Data Display Components
data.description: Learn about the data display components available in NextPlate for presenting information clearly and effectively.

ui.description: Learn about the UI components available in NextPlate for building modern interfaces.

layout.description: Learn about the layout components available in NextPlate for organizing your application content.

forms.description: Learn about the form components available in NextPlate for creating interactive and accessible forms.

introduction.title: Introduction to NextPlate
introduction.description: Learn about NextPlate, its key features, and how it can help you build modern web applications quickly.

whatIs.title: What is NextPlate?
whatIs.description: NextPlate is a comprehensive boilerplate for Next.js applications that provides a solid foundation for building modern web applications. It includes pre-configured authentication, payments, AI integration, and legal compliance features to help you get started quickly.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: Learn how to install and set up NextPlate for your project.

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: Before you start, make sure you have the following installed:

clone.title: 1. Clone the Repository
clone.description: First, clone the NextPlate repository to your local machine:

dependencies.title: 2. Install Dependencies
dependencies.description: Navigate to the project directory and install the dependencies:

env.title: 3. Set Up Environment Variables
env.description: Create a local environment file by copying the example file:

run.title: 4. Run the Development Server
run.description: Start the development server to see your application in action:

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: If you encounter any issues during installation, try the following solutions:

items.dependencies: Make sure all dependencies are correctly installed by running 'npm install' again.
items.cache: Clear npm cache with 'npm cache clean --force' and try reinstalling dependencies.
items.modules: If you see module not found errors, try deleting the node_modules folder and reinstalling dependencies.
